timeline.author: codelipenghui

replies.bodyText:
Are we worrying about potential memory leak here?
Did a rough calculation, if average topic name has 100 characters, in UTF_32 encoding which occupies 4 byte(other encoding usually take less space), a String could take 400 + ~50 (other meta) = 450 byte, if a broker ever owns 10K topics, it'll takes about 4.3MB, if a broker ever owns 100K topics it'll take about 43MB, but later case should be pretty rare. I think this should be in acceptable range.
We can add scheduled task to clean up this, but feel like we don't need to over-optimize for now?
@codelipenghui what do you think?
replies.author: MarvinCai

timeline.bodyText:
Why do I need to cache all topics? We only need to determine whether the Topic is owned by current Broker, otherwise it will be redirected.
Broker already has Topic cache.
We can determine whether it belongs to the current cluster by checking the Namespace.

replies.bodyText: I assume you're talking about the multiLayerTopicsMap in BrokerService, I took a look and it does contain topic ownership data, but it's not very handy in this use case which we need to keep track of serving topics as well as all partitions on a broker when publish to a partition topic so we can distribute message to all partitions.
